# ğŸ§ª Python Practice Notebooks

This repository is a collection of **Jupyter Notebooks (`.ipynb`)** where I practice and explore Python programming. It covers a range of topics from basics to intermediate-level problems, including hands-on examples, mini-projects, and usage of external libraries.

---

## ğŸ“ Repository Structure

```
python-practice/
â”‚
â”œâ”€â”€ basics/              # Intro to Python, variables, data types, loops, etc.

â”œâ”€â”€ oops/                # Classes, objects, inheritance, etc.
â”œâ”€â”€ data_structures/     # Lists, sets, dictionaries, stacks, queues
â”œâ”€â”€ algorithms/          # Sorting, searching, recursion, etc.
â”œâ”€â”€ pandas_numpy/        # Practice using pandas and NumPy
â”œâ”€â”€ projects/            # Mini projects and applied Python
â”œâ”€â”€ visuals/             # Plotting with matplotlib, seaborn
â”œâ”€â”€ external_libs/       # Using requests, BeautifulSoup, etc.
â””â”€â”€ README.md
```

---

## ğŸš€ Getting Started

### ğŸ“¦ Requirements

Install dependencies using pip if not already available:

```bash
pip install notebook numpy pandas matplotlib seaborn requests
```

Or use:

```bash
pip install -r requirements.txt
```

### â–¶ï¸ Running the Notebooks

1. Clone the repo:

```bash
git clone https://github.com/your-username/python-practice.git
cd python-practice
```

2. Start Jupyter:

```bash
jupyter notebook
```

Then open any `.ipynb` file from your browser.

## ğŸ§  Topics Covered

- Python Basics and Syntax
- Control Flow and Functions
- Object-Oriented Programming
- Data Structures and Algorithms
- File Handling and Web Requests
- Pandas & NumPy for Data Analysis
- Visualizations with Matplotlib and Seaborn
- Mini Projects & Real-world Use Cases

## ğŸ§° Tools Used

- [Python 3.x](https://www.python.org/)
- [Jupyter Notebook](https://jupyter.org/)

- [pandas](https://pandas.pydata.org/)
- [matplotlib](https://matplotlib.org/)
- [seaborn](https://seaborn.pydata.org/)
- [requests](https://docs.python-requests.org/)
